title: Calories in a Costco Pizza
meta_description: Discover calories in a Costco pizza, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for the whole 18-inch pie from the food court.
assumptions: Whole 18-inch cheese pizza from Costco food court; standard dough, sauce, mozzarella; baked fresh, no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, exact recipe, toppings, and slice size; values are estimates. Check Costco for latest info.

quick_answer.text: A whole Costco cheese pizza contains about 2800 kcal and 110 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Veggie toppings (e.g., peppers, onions) instead of meat

faqs.q: How many calories in a whole Costco pizza?
faqs.a: Approximately 2800 kcal for a standard cheese pizza.

faqs.q: Calories in a slice of Costco pizza?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal per slice if cut into 8 slices; varies by type.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Costco pizza?
faqs.a: Roughly 110 g protein for the whole cheese pizza.

faqs.q: Does Costco pizza have high sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 5200 mg sodium total due to cheese, sauce, and dough.

faqs.q: How do calories change with different Costco pizza types?
faqs.a: Pepperoni adds ~400 kcal; combo or meat lovers can reach 3200+ kcal.
